name: wikipedia_bulk_search
description: Search multiple topics on Wikipedia in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling wikipedia_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Comma-separated search queries (e.g. 'quantum physics,black holes,string theory')

detailSteps.code: const directArticle = document.querySelector('#firstHeading'); const isArticle = !document.querySelector('.mw-search-results'); if (isArticle && directArticle) { const content = document.querySelector('#mw-content-text .mw-parser-output'); const p = content ? content.querySelector(':scope > p') : null; return { query: new URLSearchParams(window.location.search).get('search') || directArticle.textContent.trim(), direct_match: true, title: directArticle.textContent.trim(), snippet: p ? p.textContent.trim().substring(0, 300) : '', url: window.location.href, results: [] }; } const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('.mw-search-result, .mw-search-results li'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('.mw-search-result-heading a, a'); const snippetEl = el.querySelector('.searchresult'); results.push({ title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: titleEl ? titleEl.href : '', snippet: snippetEl ? snippetEl.textContent.trim().substring(0, 200) : '' }); } return { query: new URLSearchParams(window.location.search).get('search') || '', direct_match: false, result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
